intro: Thelocephala longirapa, commonly known as the long-stemmed thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stem and rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Thelocephala longirapa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
